comments:
Using uml2-SDK-1.1RC1, the existing profile fails to apply in a type. We 
should get thz following exception: 

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException 

at 
org.eclipse.uml2.internal.operation.StereotypeOperations.getApplicableStereotyp
es(StereotypeOperations.java:425) 

at org.eclipse.uml2.impl.ElementImpl.getApplicableStereotypes
(ElementImpl.java:450) 

at org.eclipse.uml2.profile.TestCase.applyStereotypes(TestCase.java:220) 

at org.eclipse.uml2.profile.TestCase.<init>(TestCase.java:86) 

at org.eclipse.uml2.profile.TestCase.main(TestCase.java:62)

Created an attachment (id=23133)
testcase

Here is my environment:
    Eclipse: eclipse-SDK-3.1RC2-win32.zip
    EMF: emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-I200506020944.zip
    uml2-SDK-1.1RC1.zip
 
Before execution, it is necessary to modify the static variable
ProfileHelperLocal.EclipseHome to point the uml2 resource path.

The fix has been committed to CVS.

The UUID of the Type metaclass was not preserved properly when the UML2 
metamodel was updated based on the new Ecore schema.

While fixing this defect, it was discovered that the visilities of the 
elements in the metamodels (Ecore.metamodel.uml2 and UML2.metamodel.uml2) were 
incorrect; they have been corrected (change to private, as they were in UML2 
1.0.x).

Also, the default value of Operation::isUnique (as well as Operation::lower, 
Operation::upper, and Operation::isOrdered) was unspecified in the source 
model, resulting in a default default value (!) which meant that values for 
this property were being serialized unnecessarily. This has been corrected.
The fix is available in build 1.1RC2.
